meanings.definition: In a manner lacking skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: She played the piano poorly during the recital.
meanings.sent2: The new student spoke English poorly but was eager to learn.
meanings.sent3: The magician poorly attempted to pull a rabbit out of his hat, but a duck appeared instead.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were as poorly constructed as a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The chef chopped the vegetables so poorly that they were unrecognizable.

meanings.definition: In a manner indicating illness or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: After eating the expired food, he felt poorly and had to stay home.
meanings.sent2: The sick cat meowed poorly, signaling it needed attention.
meanings.sent3: The car engine coughed and sputtered, feeling poorly on the cold morning.
meanings.sent4: The old house groaned and creaked, poorly from years of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The wilting flowers in the garden looked poorly under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: In a manner lacking quality or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: The movie was poorly made, with bad acting and a weak plot.
meanings.sent2: The student's essay was poorly written, full of spelling mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella poorly shielded her from the rain, leaving her soaked.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet dripped poorly, wasting water all night.
meanings.sent5: The cheaply made toy poorly withstood the rough play of the children.
